metadata.title: CVE-2021-2180 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.33 and prior and8.0.23 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
